etymology.description: a horizontal stroke, indicating the number 'one'.
etymology.interpretation: A single horizontal line visually represents the concept of oneness. As the simplest numeral, it set the pattern for 二 and 三 by repeating the stroke to show increasing quantity.

examples.chinese: 我只有一本书(我只有一本書)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ yǒu yì běn shū.

examples.chinese: 他一到就给我打电话(他一到就給我打電話)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yí dào jiù gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
examples.english: As soon as he arrives, he calls me.

examples.chinese: 一个问题都没有(一個問題都沒有)。
